name: Hyatt Place Saratoga / Malta

reviews.text: I stayed one night and got a great rate using a Roomsavers coupon. I was really surprised at the amazing looking room with the Japanese style partition - looked like a $400 place, especially the 42" LG HDTV, desk with convenient hookups, and sectional. Everything first class. This is the hotel for geeks! Bring an HDMI cable and you're set!
reviews.title: This is not your Normal Business Class Hotel

reviews.text: They have touch screen kiosks for getting food and checking in/out, but friendly service is never far away. Nice seating areas in lobbies. Very high tech looking exercise machines in the gym with huge screens that I did not try. They sell egg breakfast meals for $7, plus all the normal bagle, fruit, yoghurt for free. Also have sandwiches available for dinner and a bar with beer (they even have Pilsner Urquell!). This is good - I'd rather pay a few bucks to get something good, then a bunch of stuff I don't want for free. Everyone was very friendly and helpful - it seems they are trying very hard to please, since this is a new hotel and they have to make a name for themselves.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't find anything to complain about. Newer hotel, nice lobby, big rooms, huge TV, comfortable bed, friendly staff. The Kiosk food situation isn't bad, if a bit overpriced.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are quite large with a huge sectional couch (ours did have a rip in it even though it's obviously quite new) a 42 inch LCD TV with every input you can imagine (laptops, portable DVD players, etc can all be plugged in easily). We actually had to turn the heat on the night we stayed, as it got chilly....the requisite burning smell appeared, but that would happen in your house too if you haven't turned the heat on in 4 months. I didn't like that you couldn't open windows to the outside to get some fresh air.
reviews.title: Great Place for the $$$

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The doors in this place are huge heavy dark wooden things..both the entrance to the rooms and the bathroom. It just feels much more expensive than what we paid. You can hear the people next door through the door adjoining rooms...but is there any hotel where this doesn't happen?
reviews.title: Just Marvelous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, clean, clean! Beautiful rooms, generous breakfast and amazing staff. Better than any hotel I've ever stayed at and I travel for business quite often. This trip was with family and it was perfect! The signature wine was great too! I wouldn't stay downtown again. This is the place to be!
reviews.title: First Class All The Way!!!!

reviews.text: 12 minutes in the car to downtown Saratoga Springs.
reviews.title: Great hotel at a fantastic price.

reviews.text: Beautiful lobby where I was met by Deborah and Carmen who for the entire duration of my stay could not have been more helpful, welcoming and friendly.
reviews.title: Stayed here for a Wedding in Saratoga - great value, beautiful facilities

reviews.text: Great little gym, pool and whirlpool.
reviews.title: Best business hotel ever!!!!

reviews.text: Room was fantastic with modern walk in shower, work desk, tea/coffee making facilities, comfy corner sofa, massive flat screen and a queen size bed that was unbelievably comfortable!
reviews.title: Wonderful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fairly new. It is very clean. The staff are amazingly helpful and courteous. We booked thorugh Priceline at a very, very reasonable rate. Upon check-in we were given a tour of the hotel and an explanation of the amenities. We were put in a King Suite with a Huge sectional couch.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel - Tremendous Value

reviews.text: The room was spotless, the bed Very comfy.
reviews.title: VERY nice hotel

reviews.text: The location is awesome--minutes from Route 87.
reviews.title: Nice ammenities, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was one of the best value's we have ever had.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel. Great Value. Hyatt has a winner with this brand.

reviews.text: I got a very good deal on this hotel via Priceline. As others have indicated, the rooms are lovely - comfortable bed, large sectional, 42" flat screen TV, great desk with convenient outlets, refrigerator. It seems that everything about the room has been so carefully thought out. The continental breakfast is fine - cereals, yogurt, granola, fresh fruit, juice, bagels, english muffins, toast, coffee, tea.
reviews.title: a peaceful oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stay at a Hyatt Place, and we will definitely stay again. The decor is fresh and modern and very well done. Our room was wonderful. The bed and linens were super comfortable and we also had a living area with couch and big wide-screen tv. There was also a separate desk/working area, and I liked have a walk in shower as opposed to a tub. The staff at this Hyatt Place was very friendly and helpful, they gave great suggestions for local dinner spots that did not disappoint. I would definitely recommend this Hyatt Place
reviews.title: What a nice hotel

aka: Hyatt Place Saratoga / Malta Hotel Malta
description: Saratoga's new all-suite hotel. Down bedding, sectional sofas and 42" HD Plasma TVs in all rooms. Free breakfast and WiFi available. Gallery Cafe features Starbucks coffee, beer& wine service and a variety of grab-n-go snacks and light entrees. State-of-the-art fitness center, heated indoor pool & whirlpool on-site. Only 10 minutes from Saratoga Springs and 20 minutes from Albany, NY.
